content:
Since the first time I used Zulip, I found the emails to be really useful as a notification...
But we can make them 10x more useful with very little effort (yay!)

Here is what they look like in Inbox:
Screen-Shot-2017-05-07-at-9.45.34-PM.png

What I really care about is, who sent me the message, and what the message is. What if we move around the text so the short notification (which looks similar on an iPhone and Android phone) so we can see the text too?
Maybe we should set the sender name as 'Zulip: John Doe' and the email itself should contain the text as the first thing?

Agreed, it's on my todo list :). I was going to do:
Sender: Zulip Missed Messages
Subject: name1 / name1 and name2 / name1, name2, and name3 / name1, name2, and others [the latter 3 for missed huddle messages]

And then I think there is something called preheader text that allows you to specify what comes after the subject, or hacks like starting the email with <div display:none>first few lines of the message ..</div>, but I haven't looked into it.
There's even an open PR for the first part of this effort: https://github.com/zulip/zulip/pull/4682
